title: Analyze Your Surroundings
description: Use the ls command to analyze your surroundings by listing all of the contents of the current directory.

title: Explore the Environment
description: Use the cd DIRECTORY_NAME command to explore the environment by changing the current directory. Make sure to replace DIRECTORY_NAME with the actual name of the directory you want to explore.

title: Determine Your Location
description: Use the pwd command to determine your location by printing the current directory's path.

title: Retrace Your Steps
description: Use the history command to view the history of the commands you have previously used.

title: Construct a Building
description: Use the mkdir DIRECTORY_NAME command to create a new directory. Make sure to replace DIRECTORY_NAME with the actual name of the directory you want to construct.

title: Demolish a Building or Room
description: Use the rm NAME command to delete files or directories. Make sure to replace NAME with the actual name of the file or directory you want to demolish.

title: Enter a Room
description: Use the cat FILE_NAME command to display the contents of a file. Make sure to replace FILE_NAME with the actual name of the file you want to enter.

title: Construct a Room
description: Use the touch FILE_NAME command to create a new file. Make sure to replace FILE_NAME with the actual name of the file you want to construct.
